p: Yanagisawa et al. studied the anti-peptic activity of compounds related to the metabolites of known API—sodium 3-ethyl-7-isopropyl-1-azulenesulfonate ( 22, KT1-32, egualen sodium) (Fig. 8) [ 48]. They synthesized six compounds ( 23–28), of which five molecules 24–28 containing 3-alkyl-1-azulenesulfonate moiety are the metabolites of 22 and assessed their antiulcer activity. Compounds 22 and 23 were treated as reference compounds in the study. Metabolites 24–28 showed lower anti-peptic activity than 22, whereas the lowest activity was revealed by compounds 27 and 28.
